head.title: Driving for Its Own Sake Is an Antisocial Act

hedline.hl1: Driving for Its Own Sake Is an Antisocial Act

abstract.p: Kenneth M Coughlin letter opposes May 24 article on nighttime car cruising in NYC (S)

block.p: I was disturbed by your celebration of the restless souls whose idea of a good time is to drive aimlessly around the city late at night (''Night Moves,'' May 24). The last time I checked, global warming from the burning of fossil fuels was a grave and growing threat to the planet's climate, and the region was still in violation of the Clean Air Act.

I was disturbed by your celebration of the restless souls whose idea of a good time is to drive aimlessly around the city late at night (''Night Moves,'' May 24). The last time I checked, global warming from the burning of fossil fuels was a grave and growing threat to the planet's climate, and the region was still in violation of the Clean Air Act.

Perhaps for the next week you can locate some similarly self-indulgent groups who take three-hour showers or needlessly run their air-conditioners for weeks on end. If we are to have any hope of reversing the automobile's insults to our environemnt, we must start driving for its own sake as the antisocial act it is.
KENNETH M. COUGHLIN Upper West Side
